title: Documentation of some macros has presentation problems

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-dev-tools
labels.description: Relevant to the dev-tools subteam, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-cross-crate-reexports
labels.description: Area: Documentation that has been re-exported from a different crate

body:
For some macros the documentation has presentation problems,
for others macros the documentation it is OK.
Problems:
- Variable names are not highlighted in blue
- There is an additional space between $ and the variable name (and in other places)
- Unexpected line breaks even when horizontal space is left (Might be a separate unrelated problem)

OK
![ok_macro_panic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1041267/18816982/5107d07a-8355-11e6-9fb4-ef0d9e995641.png)

Problematic
![error_macro_assert](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1041267/18816985/570e974c-8355-11e6-88f5-add8dedf9374.png)

Problematic macros:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.assert!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.assert_eq!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.try!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.unreachable!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.vec!.html (no problem of linebreaks here)
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.write!.html
...

Ok macros:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.cfg!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.concat!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.env!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.format_args!.html
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.panic!.html
...

It seems macros with "Stable since 1.0.0" are displayed properly?

Firefox 48.0, Ubuntu 16.04
Android, Chrome 53.0
